channel.title: How Do You Make A Mystery Box Work Please Help!
channel.description: Hello guys I am currently using Project Insanity source and client and I was wondering how would i get mystery boxes working and the mystery box to give a random item

item.title: How Do You Make A Mystery Box Work Please Help!
item.dc:creator: @beale beale
item.description:
@beale wrote:

CoderCloud:

FUNNIEST THING IVE SEEN IN MY LIFE

Why are you gravedigging this from 2 years ago…?

Read full topic

item.title: How Do You Make A Mystery Box Work Please Help!
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

You should first familiarize yourself with the source you are using. So you at least know how to add and remove items from your INVENTORY >_<! seems rather important if you ask me…

Then
c.getItems().removeItem(PUT_YOUR_ID_HERE_AND_DONT_DARE_TRY_TO_USE_THIS_CODE, 1);
to remove the id specified

To add an item, i would suggest an Item file
add the Possible Items you want added. If you want a probability of good/bad items the code gets much more complicated, but if not here:

Items.java:(or what ever PI uses)
public int[] mysteryBoxItems = {item1,item2,item3,item4,item5,item6,item7…};
Obviously you need the item id’s (God i hope you can find them)

^ coming from an Atheist, if that says anything ~_~

Read full topic
item.source: How Do You Make A Mystery Box Work Please Help!

item.title: How Do You Make A Mystery Box Work Please Help!
item.dc:creator: @Pk6uhave2 Pk6uhave2
item.description:
@Pk6uhave2 wrote:

[quote=“elite expert, post:27, topic:522641”][quote author=k1ng0frs link=topic=641140.msg4320076#msg4320076 date=1372109369]

You need to import the Misc class first off.
and second, you should already have a switch statement to put that code in.

ok that got rid of the misc error but what about the, im getting this now after i imported the misc

src\server\model\players\packets\ClickItem.java:37: error: cannot find symbol
switch(actionButton) {
^
symbol: variable actionButton
location: class ClickItem
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .

remove switch(actionButton) {

well removing that just brings me back to the ophaned case again and puts a arrow under c in case

[/quote]
YAY omg thanks alot it worked just 1 more question sorry, how do i change it so i put the items i want it to possibly give and it picks 1 at random from the items i say, also how do i make it so the mystery box disapears but still give the item, so u click it and the mystery box disappears and gives the item[/quote]

I honestly just had the best laugh of my life. You asked for a mystery box that gives a random item. So he gave you a code that does just that. Read this line, it’s common sense.

You’re adding the item, miscellaneous/random. If you change it to something like this:

c.getItems().addItem(1038), 1); (I think, so don’t rely on it)

you will get a Red partyhat. Change the 1038 to the item ID you would like to be added.

Read full topic
item.source: How Do You Make A Mystery Box Work Please Help!

item.title: How Do You Make A Mystery Box Work Please Help!
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“elite expert, post:18, topic:522641”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=641140.msg4319622#msg4319622 date=1372040614]

switch(example){
     case 0:
          System.out.println("I'm a happy case with a parent");
          break;
}
case 1:
     System.out.println("Help I need a parent. I'm an ORPHAN");
     break;

Hope this helps.

So where do i put this?

Okay. okay…
All jokes aside…
that is an example of an orphaned case. Otherwise known as, the error you just got.
[/quote]
Ok i understand i see what u gave me but where do i put it and cant u just take what i have and make the command so i can just copy and paste it in clickitem.java[/quote]

that is spoonfeeding

Read full topic
